summary.long: Luke is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Since many have undertaken to set in order a narrative concerning those matters which have been fulfilled among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even as those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and servants of the word delivered them to us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it seemed good to me also, having traced the course of all things accurately from the first, to write to you in order, most excellent Theophilus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you might know the certainty concerning the things in which you were instructed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the priestly division of Abijah. He had a wife of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were both righteous before God, walking blamelessly in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they both were well advanced in years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while he executed the priest’s office before God in the order of his division
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: according to the custom of the priest’s office, his lot was to enter into the temple of the Lord and burn incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole multitude of the people were praying outside at the hour of incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing on the right side of the altar of incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zacharias was troubled when he saw him, and fear fell upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel said to him, “Don’t be afraid, Zacharias, because your request has been heard. Your wife, Elizabeth, will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will have joy and gladness, and many will rejoice at his birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he will be great in the sight of the Lord, and he will drink no wine nor strong drink. He will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother’s womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will go before him in the spirit and power of Elijah, ‘to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children,’ and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just; to prepare a people prepared for the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zacharias said to the angel, “How can I be sure of this? For I am an old man, and my wife is well advanced in years.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel answered him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God. I was sent to speak to you and to bring you this good news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, you will be silent and not able to speak until the day that these things will happen, because you didn’t believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their proper time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were waiting for Zacharias, and they marveled that he delayed in the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came out, he could not speak to them. They perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple. He continued making signs to them, and remained mute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days of his service were fulfilled, he departed to his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these days Elizabeth his wife conceived, and she hid herself five months, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus has the Lord done to me in the days in which he looked at me, to take away my reproach among men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the sixth month, the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city of Galilee named Nazareth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to a virgin pledged to be married to a man whose name was Joseph, of David’s house. The virgin’s name was Mary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having come in, the angel said to her, “Rejoice, you highly favored one! The Lord is with you. Blessed are you among women!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when she saw him, she was greatly troubled at the saying, and considered what kind of salutation this might be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to her, “Don’t be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Behold, you will conceive in your womb and give birth to a son, and shall name him ‘Jesus.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of his father David,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and he will reign over the house of Jacob forever. There will be no end to his Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary said to the angel, “How can this be, seeing I am a virgin?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel answered her, “The Holy Spirit will come on you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. Therefore also the holy one who is born from you will be called the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Behold, Elizabeth your relative also has conceived a son in her old age; and this is the sixth month with her who was called barren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nothing spoken by God is impossible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mary said, “Behold, the servant of the Lord; let it be done to me according to your word.”
Then the angel departed from her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary arose in those days and went into the hill country with haste, into a city of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and entered into the house of Zacharias and greeted Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the baby leaped in her womb; and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She called out with a loud voice and said, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why am I so favored, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, when the voice of your greeting came into my ears, the baby leaped in my womb for joy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is she who believed, for there will be a fulfillment of the things which have been spoken to her from the Lord!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mary said,
“My soul magnifies the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he has looked at the humble state of his servant.
For behold, from now on, all generations will call me blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he who is mighty has done great things for me.
    Holy is his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His mercy is for generations and generations on those who fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has shown strength with his arm.
    He has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has put down princes from their thrones,
    and has exalted the lowly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has filled the hungry with good things.
    He has sent the rich away empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has given help to Israel, his servant, that he might remember mercy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
as he spoke to our fathers,
    to Abraham and his offspring forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary stayed with her about three months, and then returned to her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the time that Elizabeth should give birth was fulfilled, and she gave birth to a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her neighbors and her relatives heard that the Lord had magnified his mercy toward her, and they rejoiced with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day, they came to circumcise the child; and they would have called him Zacharias, after the name of his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His mother answered, “Not so; but he will be called John.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to her, “There is no one among your relatives who is called by this name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made signs to his father, what he would have him called.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked for a writing tablet, and wrote, “His name is John.”
They all marveled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His mouth was opened immediately and his tongue freed, and he spoke, blessing God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear came on all who lived around them, and all these sayings were talked about throughout all the hill country of Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who heard them laid them up in their heart, saying, “What then will this child be?” The hand of the Lord was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Spirit, and prophesied, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
    for he has visited and redeemed his people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (as he spoke by the mouth of his holy prophets who have been from of old),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: salvation from our enemies and from the hand of all who hate us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to show mercy toward our fathers,
    to remember his holy covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the oath which he swore to Abraham our father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to grant to us that we, being delivered out of the hand of our enemies,
    should serve him without fear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in holiness and righteousness before him all the days of our life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you, child, will be called a prophet of the Most High;
    for you will go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to give knowledge of salvation to his people by the remission of their sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because of the tender mercy of our God,
    by which the dawn from on high will visit us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to shine on those who sit in darkness and the shadow of death;
    to guide our feet into the way of peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The child was growing and becoming strong in spirit, and was in the desert until the day of his public appearance to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in those days, a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be enrolled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the first enrollment made when Quirinius was governor of Syria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All went to enroll themselves, everyone to his own city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judea, to David’s city, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and family of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to enroll himself with Mary, who was pledged to be married to him as wife, being pregnant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were there, the day had come for her to give birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She gave birth to her firstborn son. She wrapped him in bands of cloth and laid him in a feeding trough, because there was no room for them in the inn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were shepherds in the same country staying in the field, and keeping watch by night over their flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, an angel of the Lord stood by them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to them, “Don’t be afraid, for behold, I bring you good news of great joy which will be to all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is born to you today, in David’s city, a Savior, who is Christ the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the sign to you: you will find a baby wrapped in strips of cloth, lying in a feeding trough.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly army praising God and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Glory to God in the highest,
    on earth peace, good will toward men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the angels went away from them into the sky, the shepherds said to one another, “Let’s go to Bethlehem, now, and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has made known to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came with haste and found both Mary and Joseph, and the baby was lying in the feeding trough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw it, they publicized widely the saying which was spoken to them about this child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who heard it wondered at the things which were spoken to them by the shepherds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Mary kept all these sayings, pondering them in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, just as it was told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When eight days were fulfilled for the circumcision of the child, his name was called Jesus, which was given by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days of their purification according to the law of Moses were fulfilled, they brought him up to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (as it is written in the law of the Lord, “Every male who opens the womb shall be called holy to the Lord”),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, “A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon. This man was righteous and devout, looking for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he should not see death before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came in the Spirit into the temple. When the parents brought in the child, Jesus, that they might do concerning him according to the custom of the law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he received him into his arms and blessed God, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Now you are releasing your servant, Master,
    according to your word, in peace;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for my eyes have seen your salvation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which you have prepared before the face of all peoples;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a light for revelation to the nations,
    and the glory of your people Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph and his mother were marveling at the things which were spoken concerning him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simeon blessed them, and said to Mary, his mother, “Behold, this child is appointed for the falling and the rising of many in Israel, and for a sign which is spoken against.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, a sword will pierce through your own soul, that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher (she was of a great age, having lived with a husband seven years from her virginity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she had been a widow for about eighty-four years), who didn’t depart from the temple, worshiping with fastings and petitions night and day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Coming up at that very hour, she gave thanks to the Lord, and spoke of him to all those who were looking for redemption in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had accomplished all things that were according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city, Nazareth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The child was growing, and was becoming strong in spirit, being filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His parents went every year to Jerusalem at the feast of the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the feast;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they had fulfilled the days, as they were returning, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. Joseph and his mother didn’t know it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but supposing him to be in the company, they went a day’s journey; and they looked for him among their relatives and acquaintances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they didn’t find him, they returned to Jerusalem, looking for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the middle of the teachers, both listening to them and asking them questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who heard him were amazed at his understanding and his answers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw him, they were astonished; and his mother said to him, “Son, why have you treated us this way? Behold, your father and I were anxiously looking for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why were you looking for me? Didn’t you know that I must be in my Father’s house?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They didn’t understand the saying which he spoke to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went down with them and came to Nazareth. He was subject to them, and his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: during the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John, the son of Zacharias, in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came into all the region around the Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for remission of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet,
“The voice of one crying in the wilderness,
    ‘Make ready the way of the Lord.
Make his paths straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every valley will be filled.
Every mountain and hill will be brought low.
    The crooked will become straight,
    and the rough ways smooth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All flesh will see God’s salvation.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said therefore to the multitudes who went out to be baptized by him, “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore produce fruits worthy of repentance, and don’t begin to say among yourselves, ‘We have Abraham for our father;’ for I tell you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even now the ax also lies at the root of the trees. Every tree therefore that doesn’t produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The multitudes asked him, “What then must we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “He who has two coats, let him give to him who has none. He who has food, let him do likewise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tax collectors also came to be baptized, and they said to him, “Teacher, what must we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Collect no more than that which is appointed to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Soldiers also asked him, saying, “What about us? What must we do?”
He said to them, “Extort from no one by violence, neither accuse anyone wrongfully. Be content with your wages.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the people were in expectation, and all men reasoned in their hearts concerning John, whether perhaps he was the Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered them all, “I indeed baptize you with water, but he comes who is mightier than I, the strap of whose sandals I am not worthy to loosen. He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit and fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His winnowing fan is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor, and will gather the wheat into his barn; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then with many other exhortations he preached good news to the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him for Herodias, his brother’s wife, and for all the evil things which Herod had done,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: added this also to them all, that he shut up John in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when all the people were baptized, Jesus also had been baptized and was praying. The sky was opened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Holy Spirit descended in a bodily form like a dove on him; and a voice came out of the sky, saying “You are my beloved Son. In you I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus himself, when he began to teach, was about thirty years old, being the son (as was supposed) of Joseph, the son of Heli,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Joseph, the son of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmodam, the son of Er,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jose, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonan, the son of Eliakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Melea, the son of Menan, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Amminadab, the son of Aram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalaleel, the son of Cainan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Enos, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for forty days, being tempted by the devil. He ate nothing in those days. Afterward, when they were completed, he was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, saying, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The devil, leading him up on a high mountain, showed him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The devil said to him, “I will give you all this authority and their glory, for it has been delivered to me, and I give it to whomever I want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you therefore will worship before me, it will all be yours.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Get behind me, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and you shall serve him only.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He led him to Jerusalem and set him on the pinnacle of the temple, and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, cast yourself down from here,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for it is written,
‘He will put his angels in charge of you, to guard you;’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and,
‘On their hands they will bear you up,
    lest perhaps you dash your foot against a stone.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answering, said to him, “It has been said, ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When the devil had completed every temptation, he departed from him until another time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee, and news about him spread through all the surrounding area.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up. He entered, as was his custom, into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and stood up to read.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The book of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him. He opened the book, and found the place where it was written,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Spirit of the Lord is on me,
    because he has anointed me to preach good news to the poor.
He has sent me to heal the broken hearted,
    to proclaim release to the captives,
    recovering of sight to the blind,
    to deliver those who are crushed,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and to proclaim the acceptable year of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He closed the book, gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. The eyes of all in the synagogue were fastened on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to tell them, “Today, this Scripture has been fulfilled in your hearing.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: All testified about him and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth; and they said, “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Doubtless you will tell me this proverb, ‘Physician, heal yourself! Whatever we have heard done at Capernaum, do also here in your hometown.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He said, “Most certainly I tell you, no prophet is acceptable in his hometown.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But truly I tell you, there were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the sky was shut up three years and six months, when a great famine came over all the land.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Elijah was sent to none of them, except to Zarephath, in the land of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: There were many lepers in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, yet not one of them was cleansed, except Naaman, the Syrian.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They were all filled with wrath in the synagogue as they heard these things.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They rose up, threw him out of the city, and led him to the brow of the hill that their city was built on, that they might throw him off the cliff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, passing through the middle of them, went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee. He was teaching them on the Sabbath day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were astonished at his teaching, for his word was with authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the synagogue there was a man who had a spirit of an unclean demon; and he cried out with a loud voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Ah! what have we to do with you, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are: the Holy One of God!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silent and come out of him!” When the demon had thrown him down in the middle of them, he came out of him, having done him no harm.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Amazement came on all and they spoke together, one with another, saying, “What is this word? For with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits, and they come out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: News about him went out into every place of the surrounding region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He rose up from the synagogue and entered into Simon’s house. Simon’s mother-in-law was afflicted with a great fever, and they begged him to help her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. Immediately she rose up and served them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun was setting, all those who had any sick with various diseases brought them to him; and he laid his hands on every one of them, and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Demons also came out of many, crying out and saying, “You are the Christ, the Son of God!” Rebuking them, he didn’t allow them to speak, because they knew that he was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When it was day, he departed and went into an uninhabited place and the multitudes looked for him, and came to him, and held on to him, so that he wouldn’t go away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “I must preach the good news of God’s Kingdom to the other cities also. For this reason I have been sent.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while the multitude pressed on him and heard the word of God, he was standing by the lake of Gennesaret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw two boats standing by the lake, but the fishermen had gone out of them and were washing their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He entered into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little from the land. He sat down and taught the multitudes from the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into the deep and let down your nets for a catch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon answered him, “Master, we worked all night and caught nothing; but at your word I will let down the net.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had done this, they caught a great multitude of fish, and their net was breaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They beckoned to their partners in the other boat, that they should come and help them. They came and filled both boats, so that they began to sink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Simon Peter, when he saw it, fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was amazed, and all who were with him, at the catch of fish which they had caught;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and so also were James and John, sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon.
Jesus said to Simon, “Don’t be afraid. From now on you will be catching people alive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had brought their boats to land, they left everything, and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was in one of the cities, behold, there was a man full of leprosy. When he saw Jesus, he fell on his face and begged him, saying, “Lord, if you want to, you can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, “I want to. Be made clean.”
Immediately the leprosy left him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded him to tell no one, “But go your way and show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing according to what Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the report concerning him spread much more, and great multitudes came together to hear and to be healed by him of their infirmities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he withdrew himself into the desert and prayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On one of those days, he was teaching; and there were Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting by who had come out of every village of Galilee, Judea, and Jerusalem. The power of the Lord was with him to heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, men brought a paralyzed man on a cot, and they sought to bring him in to lay before Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not finding a way to bring him in because of the multitude, they went up to the housetop and let him down through the tiles with his cot into the middle before Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing their faith, he said to him, “Man, your sins are forgiven you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, “Who is this who speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, perceiving their thoughts, answered them, “Why are you reasoning so in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which is easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Arise and walk’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,” he said to the paralyzed man, “I tell you, arise, take up your cot, and go to your house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately he rose up before them, and took up that which he was laying on, and departed to his house, glorifying God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amazement took hold on all, and they glorified God. They were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen strange things today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things he went out and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax office, and said to him, “Follow me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He left everything, and rose up and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Levi made a great feast for him in his house. There was a great crowd of tax collectors and others who were reclining with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their scribes and the Pharisees murmured against his disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with the tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners, to repentance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Why do John’s disciples often fast and pray, likewise also the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours eat and drink?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Can you make the friends of the bridegroom fast while the bridegroom is with them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them. Then they will fast in those days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also told a parable to them. “No one puts a piece from a new garment on an old garment, or else he will tear the new, and also the piece from the new will not match the old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one puts new wine into old wineskins, or else the new wine will burst the skins, and it will be spilled and the skins will be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But new wine must be put into fresh wineskins, and both are preserved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man having drunk old wine immediately desires new, for he says, ‘The old is better.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the second Sabbath after the first, he was going through the grain fields. His disciples plucked the heads of grain and ate, rubbing them in their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of the Pharisees said to them, “Why do you do that which is not lawful to do on the Sabbath day?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, answering them, said, “Haven’t you read what David did when he was hungry, he and those who were with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how he entered into God’s house, and took and ate the show bread, and gave also to those who were with him, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “The Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It also happened on another Sabbath that he entered into the synagogue and taught. There was a man there, and his right hand was withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribes and the Pharisees watched him, to see whether he would heal on the Sabbath, that they might find an accusation against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he knew their thoughts; and he said to the man who had the withered hand, “Rise up and stand in the middle.” He arose and stood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “I will ask you something: Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked around at them all, and said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He did, and his hand was restored as sound as the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were filled with rage, and talked with one another about what they might do to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In these days, he went out to the mountain to pray, and he continued all night in prayer to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was day, he called his disciples, and from them he chose twelve, whom he also named apostles:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon, whom he also named Peter; Andrew, his brother; James; John; Philip; Bartholomew;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Matthew; Thomas; James the son of Alphaeus; Simon who was called the Zealot;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas the son of James; and Judas Iscariot, who also became a traitor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came down with them and stood on a level place, with a crowd of his disciples and a great number of the people from all Judea and Jerusalem and the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as well as those who were troubled by unclean spirits; and they were being healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the multitude sought to touch him, for power came out of him and healed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He lifted up his eyes to his disciples, and said:
“Blessed are you who are poor,
    for God’s Kingdom is yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are you who hunger now,
    for you will be filled.
Blessed are you who weep now,
    for you will laugh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are you when men hate you, and when they exclude and mock you, and throw out your name as evil, for the Son of Man’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice in that day and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in heaven, for their fathers did the same thing to the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But woe to you who are rich!
    For you have received your consolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to you, you who are full now,
    for you will be hungry.
Woe to you who laugh now,
    for you will mourn and weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe, when men speak well of you,
    for their fathers did the same thing to the false prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I tell you who hear: love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bless those who curse you, and pray for those who mistreat you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To him who strikes you on the cheek, offer also the other; and from him who takes away your cloak, don’t withhold your coat also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give to everyone who asks you, and don’t ask him who takes away your goods to give them back again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As you would like people to do to you, do exactly so to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you lend to those from whom you hope to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to receive back as much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing back; and your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High; for he is kind toward the unthankful and evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore be merciful,
    even as your Father is also merciful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t judge,
    and you won’t be judged.
Don’t condemn,
    and you won’t be condemned.
Set free,
    and you will be set free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give, and it will be given to you: good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over, will be given to you. For with the same measure you measure it will be measured back to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke a parable to them. “Can the blind guide the blind? Won’t they both fall into a pit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone when he is fully trained will be like his teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you see the speck of chaff that is in your brother’s eye, but don’t consider the beam that is in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or how can you tell your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck of chaff that is in your eye,’ when you yourself don’t see the beam that is in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck of chaff that is in your brother’s eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For there is no good tree that produces rotten fruit, nor again a rotten tree that produces good fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For each tree is known by its own fruit. For people don’t gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a bramble bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings out that which is good, and the evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart brings out that which is evil, for out of the abundance of the heart, his mouth speaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and don’t do the things which I say?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who comes to me, and hears my words and does them, I will show you who he is like.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is like a man building a house, who dug and went deep and laid a foundation on the rock. When a flood arose, the stream broke against that house, and could not shake it, because it was founded on the rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who hears and doesn’t do, is like a man who built a house on the earth without a foundation, against which the stream broke, and immediately it fell; and the ruin of that house was great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had finished speaking in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain centurion’s servant, who was dear to him, was sick and at the point of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard about Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, asking him to come and save his servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Jesus, they begged him earnestly, saying, “He is worthy for you to do this for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he loves our nation, and he built our synagogue for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went with them. When he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying to him, “Lord, don’t trouble yourself, for I am not worthy for you to come under my roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I didn’t even think myself worthy to come to you; but say the word, and my servant will be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turned and said to the multitude who followed him, “I tell you, I have not found such great faith, no, not in Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were sent, returning to the house, found that the servant who had been sick was well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon afterwards, he went to a city called Nain. Many of his disciples, along with a great multitude, went with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he came near to the gate of the city, behold, one who was dead was carried out, the only born son of his mother, and she was a widow. Many people of the city were with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her and said to her, “Don’t cry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came near and touched the coffin, and the bearers stood still. He said, “Young man, I tell you, arise!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who was dead sat up and began to speak. Then he gave him to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear took hold of all, and they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet has arisen among us!” and, “God has visited his people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This report went out concerning him in the whole of Judea and in all the surrounding region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples of John told him about all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John, calling to himself two of his disciples, sent them to Jesus, saying, “Are you the one who is coming, or should we look for another?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the men had come to him, they said, “John the Baptizer has sent us to you, saying, ‘Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that hour he cured many of diseases and plagues and evil spirits; and to many who were blind he gave sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John the things which you have seen and heard: that the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John’s messengers had departed, he began to tell the multitudes about John, “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft clothing? Behold, those who are gorgeously dressed and live delicately are in kings’ courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is he of whom it is written,
‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face,
    who will prepare your way before you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For I tell you, among those who are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptizer; yet he who is least in God’s Kingdom is greater than he.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the people and the tax collectors heard this, they declared God to be just, having been baptized with John’s baptism.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected the counsel of God, not being baptized by him themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “To what then should I compare the people of this generation? What are they like?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are like children who sit in the marketplace and call to one another, saying, ‘We piped to you, and you didn’t dance. We mourned, and you didn’t weep.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John the Baptizer came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Behold, a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom is justified by all her children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the Pharisees invited him to eat with him. He entered into the Pharisee’s house and sat at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a woman in the city who was a sinner, when she knew that he was reclining in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster jar of ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Standing behind at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears, and she wiped them with the hair of her head, kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Pharisee who had invited him saw it, he said to himself, “This man, if he were a prophet, would have perceived who and what kind of woman this is who touches him, that she is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus answered him, “Simon, I have something to tell you.”
He said, “Teacher, say on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A certain lender had two debtors. The one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they couldn’t pay, he forgave them both. Which of them therefore will love him most?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon answered, “He, I suppose, to whom he forgave the most.”
He said to him, “You have judged correctly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turning to the woman, he said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered into your house, and you gave me no water for my feet, but she has wet my feet with her tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You gave me no kiss, but she, since the time I came in, has not ceased to kiss my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You didn’t anoint my head with oil, but she has anointed my feet with ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I tell you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven, for she loved much. But one to whom little is forgiven, loves little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who sat at the table with him began to say to themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon afterwards, he went about through cities and villages, preaching and bringing the good news of God’s Kingdom. With him were the twelve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Joanna, the wife of Chuzas, Herod’s steward; Susanna; and many others who served them from their possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a great multitude came together and people from every city were coming to him, he spoke by a parable:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The farmer went out to sow his seed. As he sowed, some fell along the road, and it was trampled under foot, and the birds of the sky devoured it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seed fell on the rock, and as soon as it grew, it withered away, because it had no moisture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other fell amid the thorns, and the thorns grew with it and choked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other fell into the good ground and grew and produced one hundred times as much fruit.” As he said these things, he called out, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his disciples asked him, “What does this parable mean?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “To you it is given to know the mysteries of God’s Kingdom, but to the rest it is given in parables, that ‘seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those along the road are those who hear; then the devil comes and takes away the word from their heart, that they may not believe and be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those on the rock are they who, when they hear, receive the word with joy; but these have no root. They believe for a while, then fall away in time of temptation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What fell among the thorns, these are those who have heard, and as they go on their way they are choked with cares, riches, and pleasures of life; and they bring no fruit to maturity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in the good ground, these are those who with an honest and good heart, having heard the word, hold it tightly, and produce fruit with perseverance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, covers it with a container or puts it under a bed; but puts it on a stand, that those who enter in may see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nothing is hidden that will not be revealed, nor anything secret that will not be known and come to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful therefore how you hear. For whoever has, to him will be given; and whoever doesn’t have, from him will be taken away even that which he thinks he has.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His mother and brothers came to him, and they could not come near him for the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people told him, “Your mother and your brothers stand outside, desiring to see you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered them, “My mother and my brothers are these who hear the word of God and do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on one of those days, he entered into a boat, himself and his disciples, and he said to them, “Let’s go over to the other side of the lake.” So they launched out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as they sailed, he fell asleep. A wind storm came down on the lake, and they were taking on dangerous amounts of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to him and awoke him, saying, “Master, Master, we are dying!” He awoke and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water; then they ceased, and it was calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Where is your faith?” Being afraid, they marveled, saying to one another, “Who is this then, that he commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is opposite Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus stepped ashore, a certain man out of the city who had demons for a long time met him. He wore no clothes, and didn’t live in a house, but in the tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, “What do I have to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don’t torment me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jesus was commanding the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For the unclean spirit had often seized the man. He was kept under guard and bound with chains and fetters. Breaking the bonds apart, he was driven by the demon into the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked him, “What is your name?”
He said, “Legion,” for many demons had entered into him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They begged him that he would not command them to go into the abyss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was there a herd of many pigs feeding on the mountain, and they begged him that he would allow them to enter into those. Then he allowed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demons came out of the man and entered into the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and were drowned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those who fed them saw what had happened, they fled and told it in the city and in the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People went out to see what had happened. They came to Jesus and found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus’ feet, clothed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who saw it told them how he who had been possessed by demons was healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people of the surrounding country of the Gadarenes asked him to depart from them, for they were very much afraid. Then he entered into the boat and returned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man from whom the demons had gone out begged him that he might go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Return to your house, and declare what great things God has done for you.” He went his way, proclaiming throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus returned, the multitude welcomed him, for they were all waiting for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a man named Jairus came. He was a ruler of the synagogue. He fell down at Jesus’ feet and begged him to come into his house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he had an only born daughter, about twelve years of age, and she was dying. But as he went, the multitudes pressed against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman who had a flow of blood for twelve years, who had spent all her living on physicians and could not be healed by any,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: came behind him and touched the fringe of his cloak. Immediately the flow of her blood stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said, “Who touched me?”
When all denied it, Peter and those with him said, “Master, the multitudes press and jostle you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Someone did touch me, for I perceived that power has gone out of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling; and falling down before him declared to him in the presence of all the people the reason why she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “Daughter, cheer up. Your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he still spoke, one from the ruler of the synagogue’s house came, saying to him, “Your daughter is dead. Don’t trouble the Teacher.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus hearing it, answered him, “Don’t be afraid. Only believe, and she will be healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came to the house, he didn’t allow anyone to enter in, except Peter, John, James, the father of the child, and her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All were weeping and mourning her, but he said, “Don’t weep. She isn’t dead, but sleeping.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were ridiculing him, knowing that she was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he put them all outside, and taking her by the hand, he called, saying, “Child, arise!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her spirit returned, and she rose up immediately. He commanded that something be given to her to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her parents were amazed, but he commanded them to tell no one what had been done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called the twelve together and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent them out to preach God’s Kingdom and to heal the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Take nothing for your journey—no staffs, nor wallet, nor bread, nor money. Don’t have two tunics each.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Into whatever house you enter, stay there, and depart from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As many as don’t receive you, when you depart from that city, shake off even the dust from your feet for a testimony against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They departed and went throughout the villages, preaching the Good News and healing everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him; and he was very perplexed, because it was said by some that John had risen from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the old prophets had risen again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod said, “I beheaded John, but who is this about whom I hear such things?” He sought to see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The apostles, when they had returned, told him what things they had done.
He took them and withdrew apart to a desert region of a city called Bethsaida.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the multitudes, perceiving it, followed him. He welcomed them, spoke to them of God’s Kingdom, and he cured those who needed healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The day began to wear away; and the twelve came and said to him, “Send the multitude away, that they may go into the surrounding villages and farms and lodge and get food, for we are here in a deserted place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he said to them, “You give them something to eat.”
They said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we should go and buy food for all these people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they were about five thousand men.
He said to his disciples, “Make them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did so, and made them all sit down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to the sky, he blessed them, broke them, and gave them to the disciples to set before the multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ate and were all filled. They gathered up twelve baskets of broken pieces that were left over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was praying alone, the disciples were near him, and he asked them, “Who do the multitudes say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered, “‘John the Baptizer,’ but others say, ‘Elijah,’ and others, that one of the old prophets has risen again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
Peter answered, “The Christ of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he warned them and commanded them to tell this to no one,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to all, “If anyone desires to come after me, let him deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever will lose his life for my sake will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world, and loses or forfeits his own self?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words, of him will the Son of Man be ashamed when he comes in his glory, and the glory of the Father, and of the holy angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you the truth: There are some of those who stand here who will in no way taste of death until they see God’s Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About eight days after these sayings, he took with him Peter, John, and James, and went up onto the mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was praying, the appearance of his face was altered, and his clothing became white and dazzling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, two men were talking with him, who were Moses and Elijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who appeared in glory and spoke of his departure, which he was about to accomplish at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter and those who were with him were heavy with sleep, but when they were fully awake, they saw his glory, and the two men who stood with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were parting from him, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let’s make three tents: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah,” not knowing what he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he said these things, a cloud came and overshadowed them, and they were afraid as they entered into the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the voice came, Jesus was found alone. They were silent, and told no one in those days any of the things which they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, a great multitude met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a man from the crowd called out, saying, “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, for he is my only born child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a spirit takes him, he suddenly cries out, and it convulses him so that he foams; and it hardly departs from him, bruising him severely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I begged your disciples to cast it out, and they couldn’t.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him violently. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were all astonished at the majesty of God.
But while all were marveling at all the things which Jesus did, he said to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let these words sink into your ears, for the Son of Man will be delivered up into the hands of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they didn’t understand this saying. It was concealed from them, that they should not perceive it, and they were afraid to ask him about this saying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An argument arose among them about which of them was the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, perceiving the reasoning of their hearts, took a little child, and set him by his side,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Whoever receives this little child in my name receives me. Whoever receives me receives him who sent me. For whoever is least among you all, this one will be great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered, “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we forbade him, because he doesn’t follow with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Don’t forbid him, for he who is not against us is for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came to pass, when the days were near that he should be taken up, he intently set his face to go to Jerusalem
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sent messengers before his face. They went and entered into a village of the Samaritans, so as to prepare for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They didn’t receive him, because he was traveling with his face set toward Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his disciples, James and John, saw this, they said, “Lord, do you want us to command fire to come down from the sky and destroy them, just as Elijah did?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he turned and rebuked them, “You don’t know of what kind of spirit you are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Son of Man didn’t come to destroy men’s lives, but to save them.”
They went to another village.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went on the way, a certain man said to him, “I want to follow you wherever you go, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “The foxes have holes and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to another, “Follow me!”
But he said, “Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Leave the dead to bury their own dead, but you go and announce God’s Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another also said, “I want to follow you, Lord, but first allow me to say good-bye to those who are at my house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “No one, having put his hand to the plow and looking back, is fit for God’s Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after these things, the Lord also appointed seventy others, and sent them two by two ahead of him into every city and place where he was about to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “The harvest is indeed plentiful, but the laborers are few. Pray therefore to the Lord of the harvest, that he may send out laborers into his harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go your ways. Behold, I send you out as lambs among wolves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Carry no purse, nor wallet, nor sandals. Greet no one on the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Into whatever house you enter, first say, ‘Peace be to this house.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a son of peace is there, your peace will rest on him; but if not, it will return to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remain in that same house, eating and drinking the things they give, for the laborer is worthy of his wages. Don’t go from house to house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Into whatever city you enter and they receive you, eat the things that are set before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heal the sick who are there and tell them, ‘God’s Kingdom has come near to you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But into whatever city you enter and they don’t receive you, go out into its streets and say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Even the dust from your city that clings to us, we wipe off against you. Nevertheless know this, that God’s Kingdom has come near to you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, it will be more tolerable in that day for Sodom than for that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, will be brought down to Hades.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever listens to you listens to me, and whoever rejects you rejects me. Whoever rejects me rejects him who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventy returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons are subject to us in your name!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “I saw Satan having fallen like lightning from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I give you authority to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy. Nothing will in any way hurt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, don’t rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that same hour, Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit, and said, “I thank you, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turning to the disciples, he said, “All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is, except the Father, and who the Father is, except the Son, and he to whomever the Son desires to reveal him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turning to the disciples, he said privately, “Blessed are the eyes which see the things that you see,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I tell you that many prophets and kings desired to see the things which you see, and didn’t see them, and to hear the things which you hear, and didn’t hear them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a certain lawyer stood up and tested him, saying, “Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “What is written in the law? How do you read it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind; and your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “You have answered correctly. Do this, and you will live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, desiring to justify himself, asked Jesus, “Who is my neighbor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “A certain man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and he fell among robbers, who both stripped him and beat him, and departed, leaving him half dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By chance a certain priest was going down that way. When he saw him, he passed by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way a Levite also, when he came to the place and saw him, passed by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a certain Samaritan, as he traveled, came where he was. When he saw him, he was moved with compassion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: came to him, and bound up his wounds, pouring on oil and wine. He set him on his own animal, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day, when he departed, he took out two denarii, gave them to the host, and said to him, ‘Take care of him. Whatever you spend beyond that, I will repay you when I return.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now which of these three do you think seemed to be a neighbor to him who fell among the robbers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “He who showed mercy on him.”
Then Jesus said to him, “Go and do likewise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went on their way, he entered into a certain village, and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet and heard his word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she came up to him, and said, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister left me to serve alone? Ask her therefore to help me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered her, “Martha, Martha, you are anxious and troubled about many things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but one thing is needed. Mary has chosen the good part, which will not be taken away from her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he finished praying in a certain place, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John also taught his disciples.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “When you pray, say,
‘Our Father in heaven,
    may your name be kept holy.
May your Kingdom come.
    May your will be done on earth, as it is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give us day by day our daily bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Forgive us our sins,
    for we ourselves also forgive everyone who is indebted to us.
Bring us not into temptation,
    but deliver us from the evil one.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Which of you, if you go to a friend at midnight and tell him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for a friend of mine has come to me from a journey, and I have nothing to set before him,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he from within will answer and say, ‘Don’t bother me. The door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed. I can’t get up and give it to you’?
verses.speaker: Narrator
