verses.text: I tell you, although he will not rise and give it to him because he is his friend, yet because of his persistence, he will get up and give him as many as he needs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you, keep asking, and it will be given you. Keep seeking, and you will find. Keep knocking, and it will be opened to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone who asks receives. He who seeks finds. To him who knocks it will be opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Which of you fathers, if your son asks for bread, will give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, he won’t give him a snake instead of a fish, will he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if he asks for an egg, he won’t give him a scorpion, will he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was casting out a demon, and it was mute. When the demon had gone out, the mute man spoke; and the multitudes marveled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them said, “He casts out demons by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others, testing him, sought from him a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, knowing their thoughts, said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation. A house divided against itself falls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons by Beelzebul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I by God’s finger cast out demons, then God’s Kingdom has come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the strong man, fully armed, guards his own dwelling, his goods are safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when someone stronger attacks him and overcomes him, he takes from him his whole armor in which he trusted, and divides his plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who is not with me is against me. He who doesn’t gather with me scatters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The unclean spirit, when he has gone out of the man, passes through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he says, ‘I will turn back to my house from which I came out.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he returns, he finds it swept and put in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he goes and takes seven other spirits more evil than himself, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came to pass, as he said these things, a certain woman out of the multitude lifted up her voice and said to him, “Blessed is the womb that bore you, and the breasts which nursed you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “On the contrary, blessed are those who hear the word of God, and keep it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the multitudes were gathering together to him, he began to say, “This is an evil generation. It seeks after a sign. No sign will be given to it but the sign of Jonah the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so the Son of Man will also be to this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation and will condemn them, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, one greater than Solomon is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, one greater than Jonah is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, puts it in a cellar or under a basket, but on a stand, that those who come in may see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lamp of the body is the eye. Therefore when your eye is good, your whole body is also full of light; but when it is evil, your body also is full of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore see whether the light that is in you isn’t darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If therefore your whole body is full of light, having no part dark, it will be wholly full of light, as when the lamp with its bright shining gives you light.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as he spoke, a certain Pharisee asked him to dine with him. He went in and sat at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Pharisee saw it, he marveled that he had not first washed himself before dinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and of the platter, but your inward part is full of extortion and wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You foolish ones, didn’t he who made the outside make the inside also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But give for gifts to the needy those things which are within, and behold, all things will be clean to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and every herb, but you bypass justice and God’s love. You ought to have done these, and not to have left the other undone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you Pharisees! For you love the best seats in the synagogues and the greetings in the marketplaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like hidden graves, and the men who walk over them don’t know it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the lawyers answered him, “Teacher, in saying this you insult us also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Woe to you lawyers also! For you load men with burdens that are difficult to carry, and you yourselves won’t even lift one finger to help carry those burdens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you testify and consent to the works of your fathers. For they killed them, and you build their tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore also the wisdom of God said, ‘I will send to them prophets and apostles; and some of them they will kill and persecute,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zachariah, who perished between the altar and the sanctuary.’ Yes, I tell you, it will be required of this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you lawyers! For you took away the key of knowledge. You didn’t enter in yourselves, and those who were entering in, you hindered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he said these things to them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to be terribly angry, and to draw many things out of him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lying in wait for him, and seeking to catch him in something he might say, that they might accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, when a multitude of many thousands had gathered together, so much so that they trampled on each other, he began to tell his disciples first of all, “Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there is nothing covered up that will not be revealed, nor hidden that will not be known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore whatever you have said in the darkness will be heard in the light. What you have spoken in the ear in the inner rooms will be proclaimed on the housetops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you, my friends, don’t be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will warn you whom you should fear. Fear him who after he has killed, has power to cast into Gehenna. Yes, I tell you, fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Aren’t five sparrows sold for two assaria coins ? Not one of them is forgotten by God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the very hairs of your head are all counted. Therefore don’t be afraid. You are of more value than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you, everyone who confesses me before men, the Son of Man will also confess before the angels of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he who denies me in the presence of men will be denied in the presence of God’s angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but those who blaspheme against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they bring you before the synagogues, the rulers, and the authorities, don’t be anxious how or what you will answer or what you will say;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Holy Spirit will teach you in that same hour what you must say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the multitude said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, “Man, who made me a judge or an arbitrator over you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Beware! Keep yourselves from covetousness, for a man’s life doesn’t consist of the abundance of the things which he possesses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke a parable to them, saying, “The ground of a certain rich man produced abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He reasoned within himself, saying, ‘What will I do, because I don’t have room to store my crops?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, ‘This is what I will do. I will pull down my barns, build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will tell my soul, “Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years. Take your ease, eat, drink, and be merry.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But God said to him, ‘You foolish one, tonight your soul is required of you. The things which you have prepared—whose will they be?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So is he who lays up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to his disciples, “Therefore I tell you, don’t be anxious for your life, what you will eat, nor yet for your body, what you will wear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the ravens: they don’t sow, they don’t reap, they have no warehouse or barn, and God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than birds!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of you by being anxious can add a cubit to his height?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then you aren’t able to do even the least things, why are you anxious about the rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the lilies, how they grow. They don’t toil, neither do they spin; yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if this is how God clothes the grass in the field, which today exists and tomorrow is cast into the oven, how much more will he clothe you, O you of little faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t seek what you will eat or what you will drink; neither be anxious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the nations of the world seek after all of these things, but your Father knows that you need these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But seek God’s Kingdom, and all these things will be added to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t be afraid, little flock, for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the Kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sell what you have and give gifts to the needy. Make for yourselves purses which don’t grow old, a treasure in the heavens that doesn’t fail, where no thief approaches and no moth destroys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let your waist be dressed and your lamps burning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be like men watching for their lord when he returns from the wedding feast, that when he comes and knocks, they may immediately open to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are those servants whom the lord will find watching when he comes. Most certainly I tell you that he will dress himself, make them recline, and will come and serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be blessed if he comes in the second or third watch and finds them so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what hour the thief was coming, he would have watched and not allowed his house to be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be ready also, for the Son of Man is coming in an hour that you don’t expect him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Lord, are you telling this parable to us, or to everybody?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Who then is the faithful and wise steward, whom his lord will set over his household, to give them their portion of food at the right times?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that servant whom his lord will find doing so when he comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I tell you that he will set him over all that he has.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that servant says in his heart, ‘My lord delays his coming,’ and begins to beat the menservants and the maidservants, and to eat and drink and to be drunken,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the lord of that servant will come in a day when he isn’t expecting him and in an hour that he doesn’t know, and will cut him in two, and place his portion with the unfaithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That servant who knew his lord’s will, and didn’t prepare nor do what he wanted, will be beaten with many stripes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he who didn’t know, and did things worthy of stripes, will be beaten with few stripes. To whomever much is given, of him will much be required; and to whom much was entrusted, of him more will be asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I came to throw fire on the earth. I wish it were already kindled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how distressed I am until it is accomplished!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you think that I have come to give peace in the earth? I tell you, no, but rather division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from now on, there will be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be divided, father against son, and son against father; mother against daughter, and daughter against her mother; mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the multitudes also, “When you see a cloud rising from the west, immediately you say, ‘A shower is coming,’ and so it happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a south wind blows, you say, ‘There will be a scorching heat,’ and it happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky, but how is it that you don’t interpret this time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why don’t you judge for yourselves what is right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when you are going with your adversary before the magistrate, try diligently on the way to be released from him, lest perhaps he drag you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, you will by no means get out of there until you have paid the very last penny.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were some present at the same time who told him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Do you think that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans, because they suffered such things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, no, but unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or those eighteen on whom the tower in Siloam fell and killed them—do you think that they were worse offenders than all the men who dwell in Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, no, but, unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke this parable. “A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit on it and found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the vine dresser, ‘Behold, these three years I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree, and found none. Cut it down! Why does it waste the soil?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, ‘Lord, leave it alone this year also, until I dig around it and fertilize it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it bears fruit, fine; but if not, after that, you can cut it down.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years. She was bent over and could in no way straighten herself up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw her, he called her and said to her, “Woman, you are freed from your infirmity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He laid his hands on her, and immediately she stood up straight and glorified God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ruler of the synagogue, being indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, said to the multitude, “There are six days in which men ought to work. Therefore come on those days and be healed, and not on the Sabbath day!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord answered him, “You hypocrites! Doesn’t each one of you free his ox or his donkey from the stall on the Sabbath and lead him away to water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham whom Satan had bound eighteen long years, be freed from this bondage on the Sabbath day?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he said these things, all his adversaries were disappointed; and all the multitude rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “What is God’s Kingdom like? To what shall I compare it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a grain of mustard seed which a man took and put in his own garden. It grew and became a large tree, and the birds of the sky live in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he said, “To what shall I compare God’s Kingdom?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like yeast, which a woman took and hid in three measures of flour, until it was all leavened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went on his way through cities and villages, teaching, and traveling on to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One said to him, “Lord, are they few who are saved?”
He said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Strive to enter in by the narrow door, for many, I tell you, will seek to enter in and will not be able.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When once the master of the house has risen up and has shut the door, and you begin to stand outside and to knock at the door, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open to us!’ then he will answer and tell you, ‘I don’t know you or where you come from.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will say, ‘I tell you, I don’t know where you come from. Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets in God’s Kingdom, and yourselves being thrown outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will come from the east, west, north, and south, and will sit down in God’s Kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, there are some who are last who will be first, and there are some who are first who will be last.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that same day, some Pharisees came, saying to him, “Get out of here and go away, for Herod wants to kill you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I complete my mission.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless I must go on my way today and tomorrow and the next day, for it can’t be that a prophet would perish outside of Jerusalem.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, like a hen gathers her own brood under her wings, and you refused!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your house is left to you desolate. I tell you, you will not see me until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he went into the house of one of the rulers of the Pharisees on a Sabbath to eat bread, they were watching him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a certain man who had dropsy was in front of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, answering, spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they were silent.
He took him, and healed him, and let him go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “Which of you, if your son or an ox fell into a well, wouldn’t immediately pull him out on a Sabbath day?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They couldn’t answer him regarding these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke a parable to those who were invited, when he noticed how they chose the best seats, and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you are invited by anyone to a wedding feast, don’t sit in the best seat, since perhaps someone more honorable than you might be invited by him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he who invited both of you would come and tell you, ‘Make room for this person.’ Then you would begin, with shame, to take the lowest place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you are invited, go and sit in the lowest place, so that when he who invited you comes, he may tell you, ‘Friend, move up higher.’ Then you will be honored in the presence of all who sit at the table with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also said to the one who had invited him, “When you make a dinner or a supper, don’t call your friends, nor your brothers, nor your kinsmen, nor rich neighbors, or perhaps they might also return the favor, and pay you back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you make a feast, ask the poor, the maimed, the lame, or the blind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will be blessed, because they don’t have the resources to repay you. For you will be repaid in the resurrection of the righteous.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When one of those who sat at the table with him heard these things, he said to him, “Blessed is he who will feast in God’s Kingdom!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, “A certain man made a great supper, and he invited many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent out his servant at supper time to tell those who were invited, ‘Come, for everything is ready now.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They all as one began to make excuses.
“The first said to him, ‘I have bought a field, and I must go and see it. Please have me excused.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I must go try them out. Please have me excused.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Another said, ‘I have married a wife, and therefore I can’t come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “That servant came, and told his lord these things. Then the master of the house, being angry, said to his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in the poor, maimed, blind, and lame.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The servant said, ‘Lord, it is done as you commanded, and there is still room.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The lord said to the servant, ‘Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you that none of those men who were invited will taste of my supper. For many are called, but few are chosen.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now great multitudes were going with him. He turned and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone comes to me, and doesn’t disregard his own father, mother, wife, children, brothers, and sisters, yes, and his own life also, he can’t be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever doesn’t bear his own cross and come after me, can’t be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For which of you, desiring to build a tower, doesn’t first sit down and count the cost, to see if he has enough to complete it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or perhaps, when he has laid a foundation and isn’t able to finish, everyone who sees begins to mock him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘This man began to build and wasn’t able to finish.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what king, as he goes to encounter another king in war, will not sit down first and consider whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sends an envoy and asks for conditions of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So therefore, whoever of you who doesn’t renounce all that he has, he can’t be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Salt is good, but if the salt becomes flat and tasteless, with what do you season it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is fit neither for the soil nor for the manure pile. It is thrown out. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all the tax collectors and sinners were coming close to him to hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and the scribes murmured, saying, “This man welcomes sinners, and eats with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them this parable:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Which of you men, if you had one hundred sheep and lost one of them, wouldn’t leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness and go after the one that was lost, until he found it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he has found it, he carries it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he comes home, he calls together his friends and his neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you that even so there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents, than over ninety-nine righteous people who need no repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Or what woman, if she had ten drachma coins, if she lost one drachma coin, wouldn’t light a lamp, sweep the house, and seek diligently until she found it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the drachma which I had lost!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner repenting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “A certain man had two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me my share of your property.’ So he divided his livelihood between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not many days after, the younger son gathered all of this together and traveled into a far country. There he wasted his property with riotous living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had spent all of it, there arose a severe famine in that country, and he began to be in need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed pigs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wanted to fill his belly with the pods that the pigs ate, but no one gave him any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he came to himself, he said, ‘How many hired servants of my father’s have bread enough to spare, and I’m dying with hunger!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will get up and go to my father, and will tell him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am no more worthy to be called your son. Make me as one of your hired servants.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He arose and came to his father. But while he was still far off, his father saw him and was moved with compassion, and ran, fell on his neck, and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your sight. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring out the best robe and put it on him. Put a ring on his hand and sandals on his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring the fattened calf, kill it, and let’s eat and celebrate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for this, my son, was dead and is alive again. He was lost and is found.’ Then they began to celebrate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now his elder son was in the field. As he came near to the house, he heard music and dancing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called one of the servants to him and asked what was going on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and your father has killed the fattened calf, because he has received him back safe and healthy.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he was angry and would not go in. Therefore his father came out and begged him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered his father, ‘Behold, these many years I have served you, and I never disobeyed a commandment of yours, but you never gave me a goat, that I might celebrate with my friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when this your son came, who has devoured your living with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that is mine is yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it was appropriate to celebrate and be glad, for this, your brother, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also said to his disciples, “There was a certain rich man who had a manager. An accusation was made to him that this man was wasting his possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called him, and said to him, ‘What is this that I hear about you? Give an accounting of your management, for you can no longer be manager.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The manager said within himself, ‘What will I do, seeing that my lord is taking away the management position from me? I don’t have strength to dig. I am ashamed to beg.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know what I will do, so that when I am removed from management, they may receive me into their houses.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Calling each one of his lord’s debtors to him, he said to the first, ‘How much do you owe to my lord?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, ‘A hundred batos of oil.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to another, ‘How much do you owe?’ He said, ‘A hundred cors of wheat.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eighty.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “His lord commended the dishonest manager because he had done wisely, for the children of this world are, in their own generation, wiser than the children of the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, make for yourselves friends by means of unrighteous mammon, so that when you fail, they may receive you into the eternal tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who is faithful in a very little is faithful also in much. He who is dishonest in a very little is also dishonest in much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If therefore you have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you have not been faithful in that which is another’s, who will give you that which is your own?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No servant can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other; or else he will hold to one and despise the other. You aren’t able to serve God and Mammon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees, who were lovers of money, also heard all these things, and they scoffed at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You are those who justify yourselves in the sight of men, but God knows your hearts. For that which is exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The law and the prophets were until John. From that time the Good News of God’s Kingdom is preached, and everyone is forcing his way into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one tiny stroke of a pen in the law to fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everyone who divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery. He who marries one who is divorced from a husband commits adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now there was a certain rich man, and he was clothed in purple and fine linen, living in luxury every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain beggar, named Lazarus, was taken to his gate, full of sores,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and desiring to be fed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man’s table. Yes, even the dogs came and licked his sores.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beggar died, and he was carried away by the angels to Abraham’s bosom. The rich man also died and was buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Hades, he lifted up his eyes, being in torment, and saw Abraham far off, and Lazarus at his bosom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cried and said, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue! For I am in anguish in this flame.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But Abraham said, ‘Son, remember that you, in your lifetime, received your good things, and Lazarus, in the same way, bad things. But here he is now comforted and you are in anguish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed, that those who want to pass from here to you are not able, and that no one may cross over from there to us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said, ‘I ask you therefore, father, that you would send him to my father’s house—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have five brothers—that he may testify to them, so they won’t also come into this place of torment.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But Abraham said to him, ‘They have Moses and the prophets. Let them listen to them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if one goes to them from the dead, they will repent.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said to him, ‘If they don’t listen to Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded if one rises from the dead.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the disciples, “It is impossible that no occasions of stumbling should come, but woe to him through whom they come!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were thrown into the sea, rather than that he should cause one of these little ones to stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful. If your brother sins against you, rebuke him. If he repents, forgive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he sins against you seven times in the day, and seven times returns, saying, ‘I repent,’ you shall forgive him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “If you had faith like a grain of mustard seed, you would tell this sycamore tree, ‘Be uprooted and be planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But who is there among you, having a servant plowing or keeping sheep, that will say when he comes in from the field, ‘Come immediately and sit down at the table’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wouldn’t he rather tell him, ‘Prepare my supper, clothe yourself properly, and serve me while I eat and drink. Afterward you shall eat and drink’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded? I think not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so you also, when you have done all the things that are commanded you, say, ‘We are unworthy servants. We have done our duty.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was on his way to Jerusalem, he was passing along the borders of Samaria and Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he entered into a certain village, ten men who were lepers met him, who stood at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They lifted up their voices, saying, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw them, he said to them, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” As they went, they were cleansed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, glorifying God with a loud voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He fell on his face at Jesus’ feet, giving him thanks; and he was a Samaritan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Weren’t the ten cleansed? But where are the nine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Were there none found who returned to give glory to God, except this foreigner?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to him, “Get up, and go your way. Your faith has healed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being asked by the Pharisees when God’s Kingdom would come, he answered them, “God’s Kingdom doesn’t come with observation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: neither will they say, ‘Look, here!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ for behold, God’s Kingdom is within you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the disciples, “The days will come when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will tell you, ‘Look, here!’ or ‘Look, there!’ Don’t go away or follow after them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for as the lightning, when it flashes out of one part under the sky, shines to another part under the sky, so will the Son of Man be in his day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But first, he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As it was in the days of Noah, even so it will also be in the days of the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ate, they drank, they married, and they were given in marriage until the day that Noah entered into the ship, and the flood came and destroyed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, even as it was in the days of Lot: they ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in the day that Lot went out from Sodom, it rained fire and sulfur from the sky and destroyed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be the same way in the day that the Son of Man is revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day, he who will be on the housetop and his goods in the house, let him not go down to take them away. Let him who is in the field likewise not turn back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Lot’s wife!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever seeks to save his life loses it, but whoever loses his life preserves it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, in that night there will be two people in one bed. One will be taken and the other will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be two grinding grain together. One will be taken and the other will be left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They, answering, asked him, “Where, Lord?”
He said to them, “Where the body is, there the vultures will also be gathered together.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also spoke a parable to them that they must always pray and not give up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “There was a judge in a certain city who didn’t fear God and didn’t respect man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A widow was in that city, and she often came to him, saying, ‘Defend me from my adversary!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wouldn’t for a while; but afterward he said to himself, ‘Though I neither fear God nor respect man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet because this widow bothers me, I will defend her, or else she will wear me out by her continual coming.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Listen to what the unrighteous judge says.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Won’t God avenge his chosen ones who are crying out to him day and night, and yet he exercises patience with them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you that he will avenge them quickly. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also spoke this parable to certain people who were convinced of their own righteousness, and who despised all others:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Two men went up into the temple to pray; one was a Pharisee, and the other was a tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee stood and prayed by himself like this: ‘God, I thank you that I am not like the rest of men: extortionists, unrighteous, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fast twice a week. I give tithes of all that I get.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the tax collector, standing far away, wouldn’t even lift up his eyes to heaven, but beat his chest, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other; for everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were also bringing their babies to him, that he might touch them. But when the disciples saw it, they rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus summoned them, saying, “Allow the little children to come to me, and don’t hinder them, for God’s Kingdom belongs to such as these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most certainly, I tell you, whoever doesn’t receive God’s Kingdom like a little child, he will in no way enter into it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain ruler asked him, saying, “Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good, except one: God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments: ‘Don’t commit adultery,’ ‘Don’t murder,’ ‘Don’t steal,’ ‘Don’t give false testimony,’ ‘Honor your father and your mother.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I have observed all these things from my youth up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard these things, he said to him, “You still lack one thing. Sell all that you have and distribute it to the poor. Then you will have treasure in heaven; then come, follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he heard these things, he became very sad, for he was very rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, seeing that he became very sad, said, “How hard it is for those who have riches to enter into God’s Kingdom!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is easier for a camel to enter in through a needle’s eye than for a rich man to enter into God’s Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who heard it said, “Then who can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said, “Look, we have left everything and followed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or wife, or brothers, or parents, or children, for God’s Kingdom’s sake,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will not receive many times more in this time, and in the world to come, eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the twelve aside and said to them, “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all the things that are written through the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be completed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he will be delivered up to the Gentiles, will be mocked, treated shamefully, and spit on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will scourge and kill him. On the third day, he will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They understood none of these things. This saying was hidden from them, and they didn’t understand the things that were said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he came near Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the road, begging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hearing a multitude going by, he asked what this meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cried out, “Jesus, you son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who led the way rebuked him, that he should be quiet; but he cried out all the more, “You son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Standing still, Jesus commanded him to be brought to him. When he had come near, he asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What do you want me to do?”
He said, “Lord, that I may see again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight. Your faith has healed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately he received his sight and followed him, glorifying God. All the people, when they saw it, praised God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He entered and was passing through Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man named Zacchaeus. He was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was trying to see who Jesus was, and couldn’t because of the crowd, because he was short.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ran on ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see him, for he was going to pass that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came to the place, he looked up and saw him, and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for today I must stay at your house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hurried, came down, and received him joyfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw it, they all murmured, saying, “He has gone in to lodge with a man who is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “Behold, Lord, half of my goods I give to the poor. If I have wrongfully exacted anything of anyone, I restore four times as much.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Today, salvation has come to this house, because he also is a son of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save that which was lost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they heard these things, he went on and told a parable, because he was near Jerusalem, and they supposed that God’s Kingdom would be revealed immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said therefore, “A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom and to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called ten servants of his and gave them ten mina coins, and told them, ‘Conduct business until I come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his citizens hated him, and sent an envoy after him, saying, ‘We don’t want this man to reign over us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When he had come back again, having received the kingdom, he commanded these servants, to whom he had given the money, to be called to him, that he might know what they had gained by conducting business.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first came before him, saying, ‘Lord, your mina has made ten more minas.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said to him, ‘Well done, you good servant! Because you were found faithful with very little, you shall have authority over ten cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The second came, saying, ‘Your mina, Lord, has made five minas.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So he said to him, ‘And you are to be over five cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another came, saying, ‘Lord, behold, your mina, which I kept laid away in a handkerchief,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I feared you, because you are an exacting man. You take up that which you didn’t lay down, and reap that which you didn’t sow.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said to him, ‘Out of your own mouth I will judge you, you wicked servant! You knew that I am an exacting man, taking up that which I didn’t lay down and reaping that which I didn’t sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then why didn’t you deposit my money in the bank, and at my coming, I might have earned interest on it?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to those who stood by, ‘Take the mina away from him and give it to him who has the ten minas.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They said to him, ‘Lord, he has ten minas!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘For I tell you that to everyone who has, will more be given; but from him who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But bring those enemies of mine who didn’t want me to reign over them here, and kill them before me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having said these things, he went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came near to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the mountain that is called Olivet, he sent two of his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Go your way into the village on the other side, in which, as you enter, you will find a colt tied, which no man has ever sat upon. Untie it and bring it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ say to him: ‘The Lord needs it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were sent went away and found things just as he had told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were untying the colt, its owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “The Lord needs it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought it to Jesus. They threw their cloaks on the colt and sat Jesus on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he went, they spread their cloaks on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was now getting near, at the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works which they had seen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven, and glory in the highest!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees from the multitude said to him, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “I tell you that if these were silent, the stones would cry out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came near, he saw the city and wept over it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “If you, even you, had known today the things which belong to your peace! But now, they are hidden from your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the days will come on you when your enemies will throw up a barricade against you, surround you, hem you in on every side,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will dash you and your children within you to the ground. They will not leave in you one stone on another, because you didn’t know the time of your visitation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He entered into the temple and began to drive out those who bought and sold in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to them, “It is written, ‘My house is a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a ‘den of robbers’!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was teaching daily in the temple, but the chief priests, the scribes, and the leading men among the people sought to destroy him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They couldn’t find what they might do, for all the people hung on to every word that he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On one of those days, as he was teaching the people in the temple and preaching the Good News, the priests and scribes came to him with the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Tell us: by what authority do you do these things? Or who is giving you this authority?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “I also will ask you one question. Tell me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the baptism of John, was it from heaven, or from men?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They reasoned with themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why didn’t you believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered that they didn’t know where it was from.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard and rented it out to some farmers, and went into another country for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the proper season, he sent a servant to the farmers to collect his share of the fruit of the vineyard. But the farmers beat him and sent him away empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent yet another servant, and they also beat him and treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent yet a third, and they also wounded him and threw him out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lord of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. It may be that seeing him, they will respect him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the farmers saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do to them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will come and destroy these farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.”
When they heard that, they said, “May that never be!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he looked at them and said, “Then what is this that is written,
‘The stone which the builders rejected
    was made the chief cornerstone’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces,
    but it will crush whomever it falls on to dust.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the scribes sought to lay hands on him that very hour, but they feared the people—for they knew he had spoken this parable against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They watched him and sent out spies, who pretended to be righteous, that they might trap him in something he said, so as to deliver him up to the power and authority of the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Teacher, we know that you say and teach what is right, and aren’t partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he perceived their craftiness, and said to them, “Why do you test me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it?”
They answered, “Caesar’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Then give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They weren’t able to trap him in his words before the people. They marveled at his answer and were silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Sadducees came to him, those who deny that there is a resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man’s brother dies having a wife, and he is childless, his brother should take the wife and raise up children for his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were therefore seven brothers. The first took a wife, and died childless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second took her as wife, and he died childless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third took her, and likewise the seven all left no children, and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward the woman also died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them will she be? For the seven had her as a wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “The children of this age marry and are given in marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those who are considered worthy to attain to that age and the resurrection from the dead neither marry nor are given in marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they can’t die any more, for they are like the angels and are children of God, being children of the resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that the dead are raised, even Moses showed at the bush, when he called the Lord ‘The God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for all are alive to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the scribes answered, “Teacher, you speak well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They didn’t dare to ask him any more questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why do they say that the Christ is David’s son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David himself says in the book of Psalms,
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
    “Sit at my right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “David therefore calls him Lord, so how is he his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the hearing of all the people, he said to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Beware of those scribes who like to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the marketplaces, the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers. These will receive greater condemnation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked up and saw the rich people who were putting their gifts into the treasury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw a certain poor widow casting in two small brass coins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Truly I tell you, this poor widow put in more than all of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for all these put in gifts for God from their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, put in all that she had to live on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As some were talking about the temple and how it was decorated with beautiful stones and gifts, he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for these things which you see, the days will come in which there will not be left here one stone on another that will not be thrown down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Teacher, so when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are about to happen?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Watch out that you don’t get led astray, for many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and, ‘The time is at hand.’ Therefore don’t follow them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you hear of wars and disturbances, don’t be terrified, for these things must happen first, but the end won’t come immediately.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be great earthquakes, famines, and plagues in various places. There will be terrors and great signs from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and will persecute you, delivering you up to synagogues and prisons, bringing you before kings and governors for my name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will turn out as a testimony for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Settle it therefore in your hearts not to meditate beforehand how to answer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your adversaries will not be able to withstand or to contradict.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be handed over even by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends. They will cause some of you to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And not a hair of your head will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “By your endurance you will win your lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation is at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains. Let those who are in the middle of her depart. Let those who are in the country not enter therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these are days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who nurse infants in those days! For there will be great distress in the land and wrath to this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fall by the edge of the sword, and will be led captive into all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled down by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars; and on the earth anxiety of nations, in perplexity for the roaring of the sea and the waves;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: men fainting for fear and for expectation of the things which are coming on the world, for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when these things begin to happen, look up and lift up your heads, because your redemption is near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them a parable. “See the fig tree and all the trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they are already budding, you see it and know by your own selves that the summer is already near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so you also, when you see these things happening, know that God’s Kingdom is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, this generation will not pass away until all things are accomplished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will by no means pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So be careful, or your hearts will be loaded down with carousing, drunkenness, and cares of this life, and that day will come on you suddenly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it will come like a snare on all those who dwell on the surface of all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be watchful all the time, praying that you may be counted worthy to escape all these things that will happen, and to stand before the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every day Jesus was teaching in the temple, and every night he would go out and spend the night on the mountain that is called Olivet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people came early in the morning to him in the temple to hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the feast of unleavened bread, which is called the Passover, was approaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the scribes sought how they might put him to death, for they feared the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Satan entered into Judas, who was also called Iscariot, who was counted with the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went away and talked with the chief priests and captains about how he might deliver him to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were glad, and agreed to give him money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He consented and sought an opportunity to deliver him to them in the absence of the multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The day of unleavened bread came, on which the Passover must be sacrificed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us, that we may eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Where do you want us to prepare?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Behold, when you have entered into the city, a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him into the house which he enters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will show you a large, furnished upper room. Make preparations there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went, found things as Jesus had told them, and they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the hour had come, he sat down with the twelve apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I tell you, I will no longer by any means eat of it until it is fulfilled in God’s Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He received a cup, and when he had given thanks, he said, “Take this and share it among yourselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I tell you, I will not drink at all again from the fruit of the vine, until God’s Kingdom comes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke and gave it to them, saying, “This is my body which is given for you. Do this in memory of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, he took the cup after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But behold, the hand of him who betrays me is with me on the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man indeed goes as it has been determined, but woe to that man through whom he is betrayed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to question among themselves which of them it was who would do this thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A dispute also arose among them, which of them was considered to be greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “The kings of the nations lord it over them, and those who have authority over them are called ‘benefactors.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But not so with you. Rather, the one who is greater among you, let him become as the younger, and one who is governing, as one who serves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who is greater, one who sits at the table, or one who serves? Isn’t it he who sits at the table? But I am among you as one who serves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But you are those who have continued with me in my trials.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I confer on you a kingdom, even as my Father conferred on me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you may eat and drink at my table in my Kingdom. You will sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Simon, Simon, behold, Satan asked to have all of you, that he might sift you as wheat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I prayed for you, that your faith wouldn’t fail. You, when once you have turned again, establish your brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will by no means crow today until you deny that you know me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “When I sent you out without purse, bag, and sandals, did you lack anything?”
They said, “Nothing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “But now, whoever has a purse, let him take it, and likewise a bag. Whoever has none, let him sell his cloak, and buy a sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you that this which is written must still be fulfilled in me: ‘He was counted with transgressors.’ For that which concerns me is being fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said, “Lord, behold, here are two swords.”
He said to them, “That is enough.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came out and went, as his custom was, to the Mount of Olives. His disciples also followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was at the place, he said to them, “Pray that you don’t enter into temptation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was withdrawn from them about a stone’s throw, and he knelt down and prayed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Father, if you are willing, remove this cup from me. Nevertheless, not my will, but yours, be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angel from heaven appeared to him, strengthening him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being in agony, he prayed more earnestly. His sweat became like great drops of blood falling down on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he rose up from his prayer, he came to the disciples and found them sleeping because of grief,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Why do you sleep? Rise and pray that you may not enter into temptation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, a crowd appeared. He who was called Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. He came near to Jesus to kiss him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, do you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those who were around him saw what was about to happen, they said to him, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain one of them struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered, “Let me at least do this”—and he touched his ear and healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to the chief priests, captains of the temple, and elders, who had come against him, “Have you come out as against a robber, with swords and clubs?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I was with you in the temple daily, you didn’t stretch out your hands against me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They seized him and led him away, and brought him into the high priest’s house. But Peter followed from a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and had sat down together, Peter sat among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain servant girl saw him as he sat in the light, and looking intently at him, said, “This man also was with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He denied Jesus, saying, “Woman, I don’t know him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After a little while someone else saw him and said, “You also are one of them!”
But Peter answered, “Man, I am not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After about one hour passed, another confidently affirmed, saying, “Truly this man also was with him, for he is a Galilean!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “Man, I don’t know what you are talking about!” Immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord turned and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered the Lord’s word, how he said to him, “Before the rooster crows you will deny me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went out, and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men who held Jesus mocked him and beat him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having blindfolded him, they struck him on the face and asked him, “Prophesy! Who is the one who struck you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spoke many other things against him, insulting him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as it was day, the assembly of the elders of the people were gathered together, both chief priests and scribes, and they led him away into their council, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If you are the Christ, tell us.”
But he said to them, “If I tell you, you won’t believe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if I ask, you will in no way answer me or let me go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They all said, “Are you then the Son of God?”
He said to them, “You say it, because I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Why do we need any more witness? For we ourselves have heard from his own mouth!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole company of them rose up and brought him before Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to accuse him, saying, “We found this man perverting the nation, forbidding paying taxes to Caesar, and saying that he himself is Christ, a king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?”
He answered him, “So you say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to the chief priests and the multitudes, “I find no basis for a charge against this man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they insisted, saying, “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee even to this place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Pilate heard Galilee mentioned, he asked if the man was a Galilean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he found out that he was in Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem during those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceedingly glad, for he had wanted to see him for a long time, because he had heard many things about him. He hoped to see some miracle done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He questioned him with many words, but he gave no answers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the scribes stood, vehemently accusing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod with his soldiers humiliated him and mocked him. Dressing him in luxurious clothing, they sent him back to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod and Pilate became friends with each other that very day, for before that they were enemies with each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator
