verses.text: and said to them, “You brought this man to me as one that perverts the people, and behold, having examined him before you, I found no basis for a charge against this man concerning those things of which you accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither has Herod, for I sent you to him, and see, nothing worthy of death has been done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will therefore chastise him and release him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he had to release one prisoner to them at the feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they all cried out together, saying, “Away with this man! Release to us Barabbas!”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one who was thrown into prison for a certain revolt in the city, and for murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate spoke to them again, wanting to release Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they shouted, saying, “Crucify! Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them the third time, “Why? What evil has this man done? I have found no capital crime in him. I will therefore chastise him and release him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were urgent with loud voices, asking that he might be crucified. Their voices and the voices of the chief priests prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate decreed that what they asked for should be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He released him who had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder, for whom they asked, but he delivered Jesus up to their will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they led him away, they grabbed one Simon of Cyrene, coming from the country, and laid the cross on him to carry it after Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A great multitude of the people followed him, including women who also mourned and lamented him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, turning to them, said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, don’t weep for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, the days are coming in which they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, the wombs that never bore, and the breasts that never nursed.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will begin to tell the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and tell the hills, ‘Cover us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if they do these things in the green tree, what will be done in the dry?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were also others, two criminals, led with him to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the place that is called “The Skull”, they crucified him there with the criminals, one on the right and the other on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they don’t know what they are doing.”
Dividing his garments among them, they cast lots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people stood watching. The rulers with them also scoffed at him, saying, “He saved others. Let him save himself, if this is the Christ of God, his chosen one!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers also mocked him, coming to him and offering him vinegar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “If you are the King of the Jews, save yourself!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An inscription was also written over him in letters of Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: “THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the criminals who was hanged insulted him, saying, “If you are the Christ, save yourself and us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other answered, and rebuking him said, “Don’t you even fear God, seeing you are under the same condemnation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we indeed justly, for we receive the due reward for our deeds, but this man has done nothing wrong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to Jesus, “Lord, remember me when you come into your Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Assuredly I tell you, today you will be with me in Paradise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was torn in two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, crying with a loud voice, said, “Father, into your hands I commit my spirit!” Having said this, he breathed his last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, “Certainly this was a righteous man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the multitudes that came together to see this, when they saw the things that were done, returned home beating their chests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All his acquaintances and the women who followed with him from Galilee stood at a distance, watching these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, there was a man named Joseph, who was a member of the council, a good and righteous man
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (he had not consented to their counsel and deed), from Arimathaea, a city of the Jews, who was also waiting for God’s Kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man went to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took it down and wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb that was cut in stone, where no one had ever been laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the day of the Preparation, and the Sabbath was drawing near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women who had come with him out of Galilee followed after, and saw the tomb and how his body was laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They returned and prepared spices and ointments. On the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they and some others came to the tomb, bringing the spices which they had prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They entered in, and didn’t find the Lord Jesus’ body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were greatly perplexed about this, behold, two men stood by them in dazzling clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Becoming terrified, they bowed their faces down to the earth.
The men said to them, “Why do you seek the living among the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He isn’t here, but is risen. Remember what he told you when he was still in Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying that the Son of Man must be delivered up into the hands of sinful men and be crucified, and the third day rise again?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They remembered his words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: returned from the tomb, and told all these things to the eleven and to all the rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they were Mary Magdalene, Joanna, and Mary the mother of James. The other women with them told these things to the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These words seemed to them to be nonsense, and they didn’t believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb. Stooping and looking in, he saw the strips of linen lying by themselves, and he departed to his home, wondering what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, two of them were going that very day to a village named Emmaus, which was sixty stadia from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They talked with each other about all of these things which had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they talked and questioned together, Jesus himself came near, and went with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their eyes were kept from recognizing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “What are you talking about as you walk, and are sad?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, named Cleopas, answered him, “Are you the only stranger in Jerusalem who doesn’t know the things which have happened there in these days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “What things?”
They said to him, “The things concerning Jesus the Nazarene, who was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him up to be condemned to death, and crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we were hoping that it was he who would redeem Israel. Yes, and besides all this, it is now the third day since these things happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, certain women of our company amazed us, having arrived early at the tomb;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they didn’t find his body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels, who said that he was alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of us went to the tomb and found it just like the women had said, but they didn’t see him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Foolish people, and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Didn’t the Christ have to suffer these things and to enter into his glory?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beginning from Moses and from all the prophets, he explained to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came near to the village where they were going, and he acted like he would go further.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They urged him, saying, “Stay with us, for it is almost evening, and the day is almost over.”
He went in to stay with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had sat down at the table with them, he took the bread and gave thanks. Breaking it, he gave it to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their eyes were opened and they recognized him; then he vanished out of their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to one another, “Weren’t our hearts burning within us while he spoke to us along the way, and while he opened the Scriptures to us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They rose up that very hour, returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and those who were with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They related the things that happened along the way, and how he was recognized by them in the breaking of the bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they said these things, Jesus himself stood among them, and said to them, “Peace be to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were terrified and filled with fear, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why are you troubled? Why do doubts arise in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See my hands and my feet, that it is truly me. Touch me and see, for a spirit doesn’t have flesh and bones, as you see that I have.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they still didn’t believe for joy, and wondered, he said to them, “Do you have anything here to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave him a piece of a broiled fish and some honeycomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took them, and ate in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “This is what I told you while I was still with you, that all things which are written in the law of Moses, the prophets, and the psalms concerning me must be fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he opened their minds, that they might understand the Scriptures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name to all the nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are witnesses of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I send out the promise of my Father on you. But wait in the city of Jerusalem until you are clothed with power from on high.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He led them out as far as Bethany, and he lifted up his hands and blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he blessed them, he withdrew from them and was carried up into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They worshiped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
